content.description: Moderate crack with 2 bolts + fixed nut
content.location: Just right of 5.11 exit.  All exit routes start on wide ledge 20' to 30' below top of Hidden Wall and are used as a finish for lower routes.

content.description: Tennish climbing on great holds leads to a deceptive crux. Suprisingly fun.
content.location: Find the tree at the base of the center of the upper upper wall. It is the righthand of the two routes that depart from under this tree.

content.description: This one is sweet!  Start up the bolts just right of the obvious crack.  The line traverses right and into the crux sequence - which involves a sweet pinch and a sloppy topout.  Funky climbing continues to the anchors.  My favorite at Blacktail.  Great rock, good holds, and sweet moves.
content.location: On the upper wall, start up the bolt line just right of the obvious crack system.  The trail deposits you right at this route.

content.description: The Hidden Wall is not readily visible and most climbers who have climbed at Upper Blacktail have not seen this wall. Sharp black knobs on an 80 degree wall leads to a wide ledge with multiple exits.
content.location: Hike up behind Powertrip to hidden wall.

content.description: Runout to the first bolt, then a short crux (stepping right helps), and then enjoyable cruising to the top.
content.protection: Bolts (runout to first bolt) to 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: First route from the right on the Middle Wall (first wall you come to on the trail to Upper Blacktail)

content.description: Sharp black knobs
content.location: Hidden Wall right of Light it up

content.description: Boulder problem to start, then through some semi choosy rock. Clip first bolt on head wall, then crimp/pinch way up to "the hole"; pull onto scoop then through one more scoop, until final slab to drop-ins. Good rock.
content.location: Just left of blitzkrieg right of choss gully, follow obvious black/blue streak

content.description: This short route is mostly moderate with a short crux.
content.location: This route is on the far rightside of the Offspring Wall.

content.description: The crux is at the second bolt. I can barely reach through@ 9+ . Taller people might find this .9  . Shorter people will find this at least .10. The rest of the route is fun jug hauling.
content.location: Just right of Race Against Myself. This route is the fifth route from the left side of the Offspring Wall.

content.description: nice compact stone, easy scramble up first 2 bolts, engaging technical head wall, small holds, some long moves
content.protection: 7 bolts,  should extend 3rd clip, hard 4th clip
content.location: in between blitzkrieg and cracking cherry, clean black/blue streak

content.description:
A nice nugget of good stone on an otherwise pretty chossy chunk of rock. A couple of thin moves getting to the first bolt, then fun limestone face climbing afterwards. A good warmup. Not quite as good as Red Chili, but almost. Watch a "x"ed loose block at the top.

The photo in Wes Gooch's guidebook shows the line going slightly left of where it actually does. Start just right of a black waterstreakish section of rock.
content.location: Walk left from Power Trip on a trail. In about 50-75 yds, you'll come to another cliff. This is the second bolted route from the right.

content.description: This route is in the transition zone between loose rock on the left and great rock to the right. 2 cruxes and the bird poo ( the rock candy nugget) make this an unusual route. The route has a rare for Blacktail, fixed peg.
content.location: The route is the third from the left on the Offspring Wall.

content.description: A fun journey up some interesting holds.
content.location: The route is on the left end of the lower upper wall (Crackin' the Cherry, Muy Macho, etc...). Locate a large detached pillar. First route to the right of the pillar is Log Jammin'. Red Chili is the second route to the right of the pillar.

content.description: Great route. Well protected with continuous cruxs to a unique rest below the final crux. This is endurance climbing at it's best ( for this grade).
content.location: This route is the fourth from the left on the Offspring Wall . The first bolt is one move up ( the lowest first clip on the wall)

content.description: Located on the far right side of Upper Upper Wall ( The small crag above Upper Wall at Upper blacktail ) . Mostly fun .7/.8 jug hauling, there is a short crux at bulge near bolt. Good warm up.
content.location: See Bullit  with a name for approach.

content.description: 200' down and left (west) of the left hand side of the Offspring is a small crag (The Outer Belt) with a 6 bolt route on the left side. The route is different than typical Blacktail climbing but it's solid and good climbing.
content.location: see above

content.description: Just right of Wild at Heart is a broken formation with a right facing corner on it's right side. Just a few feet right of this corner is a crack line that goes to the top. This is the route.
content.protection: no bolts- 1 each cam to 1   3/4" , 2 - 1\2" cams, many nuts  to 3/4"
content.location: Upper Wall

content.description: A nice warmup that builds a little pump by the time you clip the anchors.
content.location: Leftmost route on the lower (Crackin' the Cherry) wall.

content.description: An OK route that delivers a challenging, short crux.  The crux comes as you hand traverse the thin seam with poor feet.
content.location: Second climb from the right on the Middle Wall (first wall you come to on the trail to Upper Blacktail)

content.description: Just right of Wild at Heart is a left facing corner. Go up corner to top of scruffy buttress. Traverse right (.7) to crack or go up face then traverse (.6) right to crack. Up crack (.6) to top
content.protection: No bolts- Trad rack or third class it
content.location: Upper Wall

content.description: Starts easy and ends easy. The crux is between bolt 2 and 3 ( don't go direct)
content.location: Located just right of Shattered Dream. This route is the sixth route from the left on the Offspring Wall (or the second from the right)

content.description: Start about 10' right of Red chili . Climb moderate rock ( gear not bolts) to the arete on the left side of the top portion of the main Lower Wall. Bolts, gear and a fixed thread lead to chains.
content.protection: Bolts, cams, nuts . The bottom is a little runout, but once you get off the ground, it is easy to the arete.
content.location: Just right of Red Chili

content.description: Sharp black knobs with vertical " bulges "
content.location: Hidden Wall right of This is the new shit

content.description: Fun face climbing on edges and pockets brings one to the crux, an affair involving two vertical rails.
content.location: This route is near the left end of the upper wall. It starts above a neatly landscaped belay area.

content.description: Shitty brittle limestone smears at the start are redeemed somewhat by interesting moves through the middle. The route left me with a bad taste on the committing, slabby finishing moves.
content.protection: Bolts. I left two carabiners on the standard (not rap) hangers in 5/07, but I don't know if they're still there.
content.location: On the upper upper cliff, locate a tree growing very close to the base near the middle of the wall. Two routes take off from beneath. Goldstein is the lefthand.

content.description: This route has variety including some roof moves, technical face moves, and a crack.
content.protection: Three bolts then traditional protection to a two bolt anchor
content.location: Start at a nice platform that is shared with Graceland. Go straight up through a small roof to begin. Finish in a crack.

content.description: On the far right edge of Upper Wall is a short crack up to a small roof. Continue up easy rock to top.
content.location: Upper Wall

content.description: The wall 100?' left of the lower wall at Upper Blacktail Butte is called The Offspring Wall.Every route on this wall was put in ground up with hand drill by Jim Beyer- solo. This route is on the far left and is a bit loose. The rating is uncertain because a hold broke.
content.protection: Bolts plus a 1"? cam at the top.
content.location: Far left route on Offspring Wall.

content.description: A unique climb that tackles a limestone crack.  The rock doesn't lend itself to natural placements - so bolts provide the protection.  Some crack skills are helpful, as hand jams keep the crack in its grade.  A long pitch for Blacktail that delivers a fine pump.
content.location: Third route from the right on the Middle Wall (the first wall you come to on the trail through the talus).  It is the obvious bolted crack... can't miss it!

content.description: This is the bolted line left of Power Trip. Big holds lead over a bulge into a moderate corner.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chains . There is a 3/4" cam placement in the corner but it' s  easier to pull on through.
content.location: Located left of Power Trip on a small buttress just left of the Lower Wall at Upper Blacktail

content.description: Fun route, very similar to Red Chili to the right. More challenging start before the ledge with a fun side-pull lie-back option above the 2nd bolt. Pretty easy after that with mostly jugs and patina crimps. Well protected with 9 bolts to rings. Originally named Log Jammin' in the 2011 book "Rock Climbing Jackson Hole & Pinedale, Wyoming" by Wesley Gooch, where it was described as being unfinished.
content.location: First route to the right of the large detached boulder. A few feet to the left of Red Chili.

content.description: Just above the Power Trip formation is another similar formation. It has a striking bolt line that's been there over 25 years. I'm not sure it goes free. Just left of previous mentioned bolt line is a bolted arete, Check my Brain. The route starts up easy, bolted junk. A short overhang arete leads to chains. I'm not sure why I put in this strange little climb hence the name.
content.location: Above Power Trip

climbs.name: Bullit with a name on it

content.description: Above the Upper Wall at Upper Blacktail is another small wall . I'ts called Upper Upper at Upper Blacktail. This route is on the left side of the wall.
content.location: Located above the Upper Wall , take the trail (below Wild at Heart) to the right out on to the scree field. The trail then switchbacks left to the base of Upper Upper and the top of Upper Wall.

content.description: An often overlooked classic. Climb through a somewhat powerful section past the first 2 bolts, 3rd bolt added, to the forth through some suspect rock. From here 'til the end, this route stays on you! Use your lightning warfare tactics to stay fresh through a pumpy lieback-esque section on an awesome rail, get to an awesome undercling, and shake out for a second. Figure out some thin moves above (don't use the tree!), clip a bolt, and dash to the anchors past an amazing limestone flake. Worthy of four stars in my book--best sport route of its grade in Jackson Hole.
content.protection: 8 bolts (Gooch's book has this incorrect), 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Next bolted route left of Crackin' the Cherry.

content.description: A bit loose and sketchy.
content.protection: 6 bolts lead to Rock Candy Nugget chains.
content.location: This is just right of Disconnected on the Offspring Wall. The left side of the Offspring Wall is loose/ shattered while the center and right side are solid.

content.description: cool finger pockets on bulge
content.location: Right of .8 exit . Climbs off ledge near top of Hidden Wall, use lower route to access.

content.description: Finger pump
content.location: Right of .9+ exit on ledge above Hidden Wall routes

content.description: Crux is clipping second bolt .  Poor rock.
content.location: The left most exit above Hidden Wall routes
